text:
SHOCKING WIFE MURDER NEAR WOLVERHAMPTON.

—On Tuesday night Christopher Edwards, aged 35, a locksmith living at Willenhall, near Wolverhampton, murdered his wife Rosannah, rather younger than himself, under very revolting circumstances. Returning home under the influence of drink, he ordered her to go upstairs, and, after locking the front and back doors, followed her with a heavy poker in one hand and a candlestick in the other. In the upper room he struck her across the eye, inflicting a fearful wound. The unfortunate woman called for assistance, but to no purpose. Her husband then struck her a succession of blows on the head with the knob end of the poker, and in a few minutes she was dead. When arrested the prisoner said:—"She commenced on me, and I punished her. I don't think she's dead. She oughtn't to be. I don't think they'll give more than 12 months, will they?" He narrowly escaped lynching by the populace.

THE PRINCESS HENRI OF THE NETHERLANDS died at Luxemburg on Wednesday morning.
